content.description: about 15 feet right, and on the other side of the dihedral by ice box crack, follow the broken line up to a bulge, pull over the left side of it to a few easier exit moves. Heads up for rock fall potential with the large block you use.
content.protection: Single rack, gear or tree anchor
content.location: about 15 feet right, and on the other side of the dihedral by ice box crack

content.description: Fun hand crack even though it is the only one on the whole cliff. It is varied in size so bring some big gear also (I think I used a new number four camalot) no anchor at the top but there are trees to sling.

There are only two climbs on this cliff that I know of, and they're worth doing if you need to get in an extra pitch or two after a long day in the narrows. Hike east through a little clearing a ways down the road. The hand crack should be pretty obvious as there are no other large cliffs near it. (there are also some fun boulders you pass on the way there, worth stopping by to do.)
